1:
Yahweh hates scales that are not accurate,\q but he delights in a precise weight.
\q
2:
When pride comes, then comes disgrace,\q but with humility comes wisdom.


\q
3:
The integrity of the upright guides them,\q but the crooked ways of the treacherous destroy them.
\q
4:
Wealth is worthless on the day of wrath,\q but doing right keeps you from death.


\q
5:
The right conduct of a blameless person makes his way straight,\q but the wicked will fall because of their own wickedness.
\q
6:
The right conduct of those who please God keeps them safe,\q but the treacherous are trapped by their cravings.


\q
7:
When a wicked man dies, his hope perishes\q and the hope that was in his strength comes to nothing.
\q
8:
The righteous person is kept away from trouble\q and it comes upon the wicked instead.


\q
9:
With his mouth the godless person destroys his neighbor,\q but through knowledge righteous people are kept safe.
\q
10:
When righteous people prosper, a city rejoices;\q when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
\q
11:
Through the good gifts of those who please God, the city becomes great;\q by the mouth of the wicked, the city is torn down.


\q
12:
The man who has contempt for his friend has no sense,\q but a man of understanding keeps quiet.
\q
13:
Whoever goes around slandering reveals secrets,\q but a faithful person keeps a matter covered.

\q
14:
Where there is no wise direction, a nation falls,\q but victory comes by consulting many advisors.


\q
15:
Whoever guarantees a loan for a stranger will surely suffer harm,\q but the one who hates giving a pledge in that kind of promise is safe.
\q
16:
A gracious woman gets honor,\q but ruthless people grasp for wealth.

\q
17:
A kind person benefits himself,\q but one who is cruel hurts himself.
\q
18:
The wicked person lies to get his wages,\q but one who sows what is right reaps the wages of truth.


\q
19:
An honest person who does what is right will live,\q but the one who pursues evil will die.
\q
20:
Yahweh hates those whose hearts are perverse,\q but he delights in those whose ways are blameless.


\q
21:
Be sure of this—the wicked person will not go unpunished,\q but the descendants of righteous people will be kept safe.
\q
22:
Like a gold ring in a pig's nose\q is a beautiful woman without discretion.


\q
23:
The desires of righteous people result in good,\q but wicked people can only hope for wrath.
\q
24:
There is one who sows seed—he will accumulate even more;\q another does not sow—he comes to poverty.

\q
25:
The generous person will prosper\q and the one who gives water to others will have water for himself.
\q
26:
People curse the man who refuses to sell grain,\q but good gifts crown the head of him who sells it.


\q
27:
The one who diligently seeks good is also seeking favor,\q but the one who searches for evil will find it.
\q
28:
Those who trust in their riches will fall,\q but like the leaf, righteous people will flourish.


\q
29:
The one who brings trouble on his own household will inherit the wind\q and the fool will become a servant to the wise of heart.


\q
30:
The righteous person will be like a tree of life,\q but violence takes away lives.
\q
31: Behold! The righteous person receives what he deserves;\q how much more the wicked and the sinner!
